trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.
The ClientTargetCollection type allows access to the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget> elements of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTargetSection> section element collection.
It belongs to a group that includes <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTargetSection>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTargetCollection"></xref> class.
The ClientTargetCollection constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTargetCollection> class by using the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTargetSection.ClientTargets%2A> property.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> object to the collection.

Before adding a client target to the collection, you must create a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget> object and initialize its <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget.Alias%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget.UserAgent%2A> properties.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> to add to the collection.
Returns an array of the keys for all the configuration elements contained in the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTargetCollection"></xref> collection.
The array of the keys for all of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> objects contained in the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTargetCollection"></xref>.
Removes all the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> objects from the collection.
The result of updating the configuration file after calling the Clear method is dependent upon the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> value chosen.

To update the configuration file you use one of these two methods: <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

> [!NOTE] > Calling <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is equivalent to calling <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> when the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> value is modified.

If you use the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method, the following conditions apply: - If you pass the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> or <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> parameter value, then a `clear` element is inserted into the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.

- If you pass the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> parameter value, a series of `remove` elements are added to the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
This removes all references to the `add` elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.
With the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> enumeration value, one additional property on the collection affects what gets serialized to the configuration file.
The property is <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> and is `false` by default.

One of the following conditions applies: - When <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> is set to `true`, a `clear` element is inserted into the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
This removes all references to the `add` elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.

- When <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> is set to `false`, the `clear` element is removed from the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level, if it exists.
The Clear method actually deletes the `add` elements defined in the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
It also removes all references to the `add` elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.
> [!NOTE] > The `add` elements are not deleted from the `clientTarget` section of the parent configuration files.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets the collection key for the specified element.
The collection index of the element to get.
A string containing the value of the key.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> object at the specified index.
The collection index of the object.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> object at the specified index.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> object with the specified name.
The user agent's name.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> object with the specified name.
To be added.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> object with the specified alias from the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ClientTargetCollection.Remove%2A> method deletes the `add` element in the `clientTarget` section at the current hierarchy level and inserts a `remove` element.
The `remove` element effectively removes the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy but does not delete it.
The alias of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> to remove.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> object from the collection.
The Remove method deletes the `add` element in the `clientTarget` section at the current hierarchy level and inserts a `remove` element.
The `remove` element effectively removes the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy but does not delete it.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> to remove.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> object with the specified collection index.
The RemoveAt method deletes the `add` element in the `clientTarget` section at the current hierarchy level and inserts a `remove` element.
The `remove` element effectively removes the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy but does not delete it.
The collection index of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ClientTarget"></xref> to remove.
